About Us

DREAM.BUILD.INSPIRE.

“The separation of talent and skill is one of the greatest misunderstood concepts for people who are trying to excel, who have dreams, who want to do things. Talent you have naturally. Skill is only developed by hours and hours and hours of beating on your craft. [That's why] Greatness is not this wonderful, esoteric, elusive, god-like feature that only the special among us will ever taste, it’s something that truly exists in all of us.” – Will Smith

Partners

Exclusive Content

Learn More!

Take a look at some of our featured content, which inlcudes interviews from some of the most prominent artists in the industry.

Jimmy Kimmel Live

Jimmy Kimmel

Sandra Bullock

Emmy-winning funnyman Jimmy Kimmel serves up comedy bits and welcomes guests that include other comics, celebrities, athletes and musicians, as well as everyday people with unusual or compelling personal stories. Kimmel's family and friends take part in the festivities, including his Cousin Sal, Uncle Frank (until his death in 2011) and childhood friend Cleto Escobedo III, who leads the show's house band.

J.R.E.

Joe Rogan

Mike Baker

Rogan is host of The Joe Rogan Experience, a long form conversation with guests that is one of the most popular podcasts, currently distributed exclusively on Spotify.

GEMS

XO

Atlanta

Highlighting forgotten moments both old and new. This series features content from the known and unknown, the respected and disparaged, and from the prominent and the nameless. We seek to find hidden gems that can encourage dialog while moving the culture foward.

XPosed

XO

Jodie Foster

Featurettes, interviews, clips, and behind the scenes from some of the film industry's best. We take a look at the process behind making some of our favorite movies and learn more about cast and crew that help bring them to life. Our goal is to highlight the work done in the dark, but never exposed to the light.

Amelia Clarke

Actor

Emilia Isobel Euphemia Rose Clarke is an English actress. She studied at the Drama Centre London, appearing in a number of stage productions. Her television debut was a guest appearance in the BBC One medical soap opera Doctors in 2009.
